bio: Bradley Holt is a web developer, entrepreneur, non-profit board member, free/open source software contributor, community facilitator, speaker, and an author. He is the co-founder of [Found Line](http://foundline.com/), a creative studio with capabilities in web development, web design, and print design. He is a Board Member at [Vermont Community Access Media](http://www.vermontcam.org/) (VCAM)—a non-profit community media and technology center—and the [Burlington Web Application Group](http://www.btvwag.org/) (BTVWAG). He is a member of the [Telecommunications Advisory Committee](http://www.btacvt.com/) for the [City of Burlington](http://www.ci.burlington.vt.us/), Vermont where his role is to advise the City Council on matters related to [Burlington Telecom](http://www.burlingtontelecom.net/), a municipally owned telecommunications services provider. He is a minor contributor of source code, bug reports, or documentation to several free/open source projects including [PHP](http://php.net/) and [Zend Framework](http://framework.zend.com/). He organizes the [Burlington, Vermont PHP Users Group](http://groups.google.com/group/burlington-vt-php) and is a co-organizer of [Vermont Code Camp](http://vtcodecamp.org/) as well as the [Northeast PHP Conference](http://www.northeastphp.org/). He has spoken at [SXSW Interactive](http://sxsw.com/interactive), [OSCON](http://www.oscon.com/), [OSCON Data](http://oscon.com/data), the [jQuery Conference](http://events.jquery.org/2011/boston/), [ZendCon](http://zendcon.com/), and [CouchConf](http://www.couchbase.com/couchconf-nyc). He is the author of [*Writing and Querying MapReduce Views in CouchDB*](http://oreilly.com/catalog/9781449303129/) and [*Scaling CouchDB*](http://oreilly.com/catalog/9781449303129/), both published by O'Reilly Media. He blogs at [bradley-holt.com](http://bradley-holt.com/) and can be found on Twitter as @[BradleyHolt](http://twitter.com/BradleyHolt).
